editorialNotes.standard: When a much-loved Canadian icon launches an innovative way for us Canucks to get our Timmy’s faster and easier, well, it’s a natural Editors’ Choice. We love that the app’s simple, scrollable menu makes it easy to preorder exactly what we want. The app offers up the closest participating pick-up locations, complete with map and directions. And we can use Apple Pay, an easy way to top up our Tim’s card account. The best part: skipping the line and heading straight for the Mobile Pickup signs!

editorialNotes.standard: If you see people filming themselves doing literally anything, they’re probably doing it for this. Scroll infinitely through perfect lip-syncs and dance moves, hilarious sketches, fluffy pets, and bites of pop culture that spark a million memes.
editorialNotes.short: Make awesome short music videos that you can share with the world.

editorialNotes.short: Manage your mail efficiently and never miss an important event.

editorialNotes.tagline: A fun way to learn a language
editorialNotes.standard: With its friendly approach and awesome updates, Duolingo’s long been one of our favourite apps for learning another language. Its secret: making the process genuinely fun. Engaging mini-games test your reading, writing and speaking skills, and joining a club (where you can encourage and compete with others) adds a great social element. Bonus: all those languages and games are available for free!
editorialNotes.short: Learn a new language. Join a club, chat with bots and get reminders to practice.
Book your ride and know exactly how much it’ll cost.

editorialNotes.tagline: All your favourites in one place
editorialNotes.standard: The House of Mouse presents its massive catalogue from Disney, Pixar, Marvel, Star Wars, National Geographic, and more to stream with wild abandon. And using GroupWatch, you can follow along with friends in real time.

Airbnb has totally changed the way we find places to stay. The unique service is packed with amazing spots all around the world—from cottages in France to New York City condos. Book private rooms, share homes with a host or list your own space. This full-featured app boasts thousands of rent-ready pads, intuitive filters and a beautiful design.
editorialNotes.short: Unique properties and memorable experiences for an unforgettable trip.

editorialNotes.standard: You need toothpaste, golf clubs, and batteries—and you need them now. Known for its colossal shopping catalog, Amazon packs virtually all of the features and functions found on its website into this ample app, whether you’re buying gifts, tracking orders, or scanning items in a brick-and-mortar store for an online price comparison. It’s easy to navigate, intuitive, and extremely fast.
editorialNotes.short: Size up your next couch with AR product stickers

editorialNotes.tagline: File on your iPhone or iPad

editorialNotes.standard: Master logos, posters, and invitations in minutes with this easy-to-use app. It’s democratised design, with thousands of templates and almost unlimited ways to customize them.
editorialNotes.short: Thousands of professional templates

editorialNotes.standard: It’s become our go-to way (and word) for connecting with people in other places. Featuring elegant design, reliable performance, and constantly evolving features.

editorialNotes.standard: Whether you love films, kittens, science, kittens, politics or kittens, Reddit’s official app puts all this (plus kittens) at your fingertips. With a colourful and intuitive layout, it’s easy to browse and post to “the front page of the Internet” across thousands of subreddits that cater to virtually every area of interest. Search for communities that line up with your hobbies; filter posts by posting time, hotness and more; and get a breakdown of your own Redditing history to see where you reaped all that sweet, sweet karma. (Protip: you can’t go wrong with pictures of—you guessed it—kittens.)
editorialNotes.short: Discover communities and topics.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.tagline: Load your card on Apple Watch
editorialNotes.standard: We’ve had Starbucks’ super-handy app on our phones for ages, and it’s staying right there. The streamlined dashboard gives us quick access to features like rewards and gift cards. Plus, we can place an order at any of more than 7,700 company-owned stores nationwide and pay ahead of time—and when we arrive, it’s all ready to pick up.
editorialNotes.short: Get quick access to rewards and gift cards from a streamlined dashboard.

editorialNotes.standard: Daunted by having to fill out a dating app profile? Showcase your best self here with conversation prompts (think “two truths and a lie”) that create fun and flirty ways to engage.
editorialNotes.short: Stop swiping and start a great conversation.

editorialNotes.tagline: Work at home or on the go
editorialNotes.standard: Here’s a simple truth: We don’t work with documents on mobile the same way we do on desktop. So it makes sense that Microsoft reimagined Office for a uniquely mobile experience where being productive feels frictionless.
editorialNotes.short: Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
